etymology.interpretation: Combines an indefinite base 什 with the suffix 么/麼 to form a general interrogative pronoun. Common in colloquial Mandarin for asking about identity, nature, or content.
etymology.simplification: 麼 was simplified to 么 to reduce strokes and reflect the frequent colloquial suffix; 什 stayed the same.

parts.english: what (in compounds); which; assorted; file (troop unit)
interrogative/final suffix; what (suffix); how (as in 多么); tiny (archaic)

examples.chinese: 你在做什么(你在做什麼)？
这是什么东西(這是什麼東西)？
你想喝点什么(你想喝點什麼)？
examples.english: What would you like to drink?
